issue.title: QField Offline layer is empty
issue.body:
I have a QGIS project, with multiple layers. Some are shape (.shp) files, others are geopackage (.gpkg) files.

I am having problems with one of the layers in a geopackage called 'trees.gpkg'. The geopackage contains two layers: 'tree-pt' and 'tree-ar', containing approximately 2500 and 200 features respectively . 

I am packaging using QFieldSync for cable export. Cable layer action for both layers is set to offline editing. However, in the packaged QField project, the layer 'tree-pt' is empty. All source files and QField project are on local (not network) drives.

If I set the 'Cable layer action' action for 'tree-pt' to  copy, it is not empty. 

If I create two geopackages, one for each layer, and for each set 'Cable layer action' to 'offline editing', neither is empty. This is a  workaround solution that I will use, but I suspect this is a bug and hence why I have posted the issue.

Although I have encountered this issue on other projects, it does not occur for all projects and I cannot reliably recreate the issue. For this particular project, I have tried creating a new project using the same layers but the problem persists. In this same project I have another geopackage called 'relations.gpkg' that contains three non-spatial tables. These are also set to 'offline editing' and all package successfuly for QFIeld.  

To be clear, the issue seems to be that for a particular geopackage file containing two (or more?) layers, when using 'offline editing' one layer does not package correctly and is empty in the QField Project.

**Software**
 - OS: Windows10
 - QGIS Version 3.28.11
 - QFieldSync Version 4.6.0

Unfortunately, I cannot share the project publicly.

Any suggestions welcomed.

issue.title: HTML Widget in attributes form not showing
issue.body:
### Describe the issue Data of HTML Widget in attributes form not showing anymore (worked in QField 2) ### Reproduction steps Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Generate a HTML Widget in attributes form in QGIS (for example `Baumnummer
`) 2. Open project in QField ### Expected behavior Showing inserted data via widget. ### Observed behavior Nothing is showed. ### Screenshots and GIFs QField 2 ![Screenshot_QField2](https://github.com/opengisch/QField/assets/54360394/02bee090-9b7c-456d-a427-315b3e9a7178) QField 3 ![Screenshot_QField3](https://github.com/opengisch/QField/assets/54360394/c1573bb4-06df-480b-9853-3f30e6a4c9d5) ### Desktop - OS: Windows - QGIS Version 3.28.10 ### Mobile (please complete the following information) - Device: Blackview BV9900 - OS: Android 9 - QField version: 3.0.4 f928e3 ### Additional information * Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of QField: Yes (not in QField 2) * Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes * Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes

comment.body: @baumsicht , great, thanks for reporting the regression. How's 3.0 for you otherwise? Enjoying the new features?

comment.body:
@abdullamuthana , prior to QField 3.0, we were not sorting feature lists (eg the list you get when identifying features through tapping on the screen). 

Your malformed geopackage leads to the loss of feature ID when sorting features. It is replicable in QGIS too. I'm surprised the geopackage worked at all considering the empty attribute name used for the indexed ID.

issue.body:
### Describe the issue
if there is any feature on the map then i want to edit the feature after that the edit i have done not save

comment.body:
> @abdullamuthana , thanks this is helpful.
> 
> Turns out that the problem has to do with your geopackage structure. For some reason, your feature ID column in your layers are name-less, i.e.:
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1728657/278545800-cd32d196-e577-4b62-8b7d-fe9e610865ce.png)
> 
> This results in QGIS/gdal not being able to add the feature ID column when sorting features. In QField 3.0, we now sort feature lists, which means in your case that editing sorted features results in a missing ID needed to save the edits.
> 
> My suggestion is to simply edit your geopackage and name the fid columns "fid" (you can do that easily using the open source sqlite browser application) That fixes the situation.
> 
> You could also file an issue upstream in QGIS, but in this case I think name-less columns is the problem, not QGIS :)

You mean the issue happen because the id column is NULL ?

issue.title: Feature Not Saved after edit it ( Last Update )
issue.body:
### Describe the issue
if there is any feature on the map then i want to edit the feature after that the edit i have done not save


### Observed behavior
When i try to edit any feature on the map it said Changes Saved but it's not saved 

### Screenshots and GIFs
Already Added

[Please also attach additional files if a 
![Error Message](https://github.com/opengisch/QField/assets/63540100/dfc7da26-c0d1-42b7-a6a3-b0304c6b18cc)
specific project/dataset is useful to investigate the problem.]

### Desktop (please complete the following information)
Qfield Last Update

### Mobile (please complete the following information)
 - Device: [iPhone13 pro max]
 - OS: [Android 11]
 - QField version: 3.0.4 - Amazonia

### Additional information
* Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of QField: Yes
* Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes
* Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes All

comment.body:
@abdullamuthana , thanks this is helpful.

Turns out that the problem has to do with your geopackage structure. For some reason, your feature ID column in your layers are name-less, i.e.:

![image](https://github.com/opengisch/QField/assets/1728657/cd32d196-e577-4b62-8b7d-fe9e610865ce)

This results in QGIS/gdal not being able to add the feature ID column when sorting features. In QField 3.0, we now sort feature lists, which means in your case that editing sorted features results in a missing ID needed to save the edits.

My suggestion is to simply edit your geopackage and name the fid columns "fid" (you can do that easily using the open source sqlite browser application) That fixes the situation.

You could also file an issue upstream in QGIS, but in this case I think name-less columns is the problem, not QGIS :)

issue.title: Feature Not Saved after edit it ( Last Update )
issue.body:
### Describe the issue
if there is any feature on the map then i want to edit the feature after that the edit i have done not save


### Observed behavior
When i try to edit any feature on the map it said Changes Saved but it's not saved 

### Screenshots and GIFs
Already Added

[Please also attach additional files if a 
![Error Message](https://github.com/opengisch/QField/assets/63540100/dfc7da26-c0d1-42b7-a6a3-b0304c6b18cc)
specific project/dataset is useful to investigate the problem.]

### Desktop (please complete the following information)
Qfield Last Update

### Mobile (please complete the following information)
 - Device: [iPhone13 pro max]
 - OS: [Android 11]
 - QField version: 3.0.4 - Amazonia

### Additional information
* Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of QField: Yes
* Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes
* Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes All

commits.message: Implement mechanism to update a local project from a ZIP archive
Tweak popup location, add missing slash
Avoid using obsolete menu ids to launch intents on Android, remove obsolete menu XML and strings
Rename update project from archive to update project from ZIP to harmonize with the import action label

Merge pull request #4670 from opengisch/update_local_project

Update local project from archive functionality

pull_request.title: Update local project from archive functionality
pull_request.body:
This PR implements a method through which local projects can be updated from an archive. The intent of this is to allow for users to update non-cloud projects with refreshed datasets (and/or project settings) while in the field. 

UI-wise, a floating tool button now appears when opening the current project's root folder:

![image](https://github.com/opengisch/QField/assets/1728657/fafa0432-84c5-4ee7-8643-76a71e4d3f43)

When clicked, a menu pops up offering users to update the project from an archive file. When clicking on the menu item, a file picker appears which is used to select the ZIP archive that consists of the refreshed data.

Once the ZIP is selected, QField will decompress the content of the ZIP file into the current project's root folder, overwriting preexisting datasets (and the project .qgs/.qgz) as well as adding new datasets. 

The ZIP archive does *not* need to contain a project file, nor does it need to include all datasets for the currently opened project. This insures that the update file will remain as small as possible (i.e., users won't need to download that 1gb geotiff that was initially transferred via USB)

Additional notes:
- Implementation covers Android only as we do not have the required iOS ZIP handling in place;
- The functionality is available _only_ for local projects (i.e., not for cloud projects, nor standalone datasets).
